items.sentence: I'd like to give you a bicycle as a present for your birthday.
I wish I'd listened to my mother's advice and become a lawyer.
I got up early so that I might be in time for the first train.
I sat next to a man on the airplane who snored the whole time.
"I can't bear to be doing nothing!" you often hear people say.
I never leave on vacation without first cleaning my apartment.
There aren't many people in this village who can speak French.
Tom stopped hitting Mary when he noticed people were watching.
Please tell Tom that he doesn't need to close all the windows.
I really appreciate the invitation, but I won't be able to go.
I'll stay here with Tom until his parents come to pick him up.
Tom had a pair of fuzzy dice hanging from his rearview mirror.
Tom was afraid to ask Mary's father's permission to marry her.
It's not what you look like that matters, but what you can do.
The last time I came to this park, I parked in the same place.
The girl who's riding on the back of Tom's motorcycle is Mary.
Tom knew Mary wasn't from Boston even though she said she was.
Tom went to the stable to see if all the horses are all right.
Tom was a kind and gentle man, well loved by all who knew him.
Tom's shirt wasn't ironed and he'd forgotten to comb his hair.
